Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>: "The difference between the four flowers are..."

Entry.JapaneseText: ここがラジルダか。 なんだか、のどかな街だな。
Entry.EnglishText: So this is Razilda, huh. Seems pretty laid back here.

Entry.JapaneseText: 今までに 来た事はないのか？
そうか…… 秘薬の事を知っている人を 探すしかないな。
Entry.EnglishText: I see... Guess we'll just have to find someone who knows about the medicine.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……じゃあ、<Hilda>はここに ゲオルギアスの事を調べるために 来たってわけか。
Entry.EnglishText: ...So you came here to dig up information on Geyorkias.

Entry.JapaneseText: 聖なる王と呼ばれたゲオルギアス…… もしかしたら、その力を使えば…… 私のこの身体も……
Entry.EnglishText: Geyorkias, also known as the <Blue>Sacred King<White>... If I could get my hands on that power, then this body of mine...

Entry.JapaneseText: ラジルダに、不思議な力の言い伝えが あるって噂を聞いて来たけど…… 誰が知ってるの？ ……って感じ。 お手上げよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I was chasing a rumor I heard that there was a legend in Razilda about a mysterious power... But no such luck. I give up.

Entry.JapaneseText: で、あんたたちはどうするの？ <Eugene>を救うための薬は 手に入らなかったんでしょ？
Entry.EnglishText: Anyway, what are you going to do about the medicine that <Eugene> needs?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……もういっぺん 頼んでみるか？
Entry.EnglishText: ...Maybe we could try asking Eaga again?

Entry.JapaneseText: 行くだけ無駄よ。この街は、 ヒューマとガジュマの間に、 強い対抗意識があるわ。
Entry.EnglishText: You'd be wasting your time. There's a deep antagonism between Huma and Gajuma in this town.

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマのためにヒューマが、 手を貸す事はない。 もちろん、その逆もね。
Entry.EnglishText: No Huma will lend their aid to a Gajuma, and vice versa, of course.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Annie>、作り方とか わからないのか？
Entry.EnglishText: <Annie>, couldn't you try making the medicine yourself?

Entry.JapaneseText: イーガさんは、ベルデ草から 作るって言ってましたけど、 製法はわからないし……
Entry.EnglishText: Mr. Eaga said that it's made from Belde Grass, but unfortunately I wouldn't know what to do with it...

Entry.JapaneseText: ベルデ草なら、この先の アズーラ海岸に生えてるわ。 材料だけでも集めておけば？
Entry.EnglishText: If you're looking for Belde Grass, it grows along the Azura Coast. Why don't we just gather the ingredients for now?

Entry.JapaneseText: そりゃいいや、行こうぜ!! 薬の作り方はベルデ草を見つけてから 調べるなりすりゃいい話だ。
Entry.EnglishText: That's a great idea, let's go! We can figure out how to make it once we get our hands on some Belde Grass.

Entry.JapaneseText: 調べものも行き詰まってた事だし、 私もあんたたちにつきあうわ。 目先を変えれば、新しい何かが 見えるかもしれない……
Entry.EnglishText: Since all of my leads have gone cold, I'll tag along. Who knows? The change in scenery might help me see things in a new light...

Entry.JapaneseText: アズーラ海岸は、この街から 南に行ったところよ。
Entry.EnglishText: The Azura Coast is south of this village.

Entry.JapaneseText: 以前とは、街の様子が 違うような気がしないか？
Entry.EnglishText: Does something about this town feel different since the last time we were here?

Entry.JapaneseText: ええ……街の人の表情が硬いわ。 それに気のせいか、前よりも静かね。
Entry.EnglishText: It does... The townsfolk have a harsh look in their eyes. And it might just be my imagination, but it seems quieter as well.

Entry.JapaneseText: 思念の影響で、以前にも増して 緊張が高まっているんだろう。
Entry.EnglishText: The situation here is probably growing more tense due to the influence of the <Blue>Will<White>.

Entry.JapaneseText: なんかあったみたいだな。 行ってみようぜ！
Entry.EnglishText: It looks like something is going on. Let's follow him!

Entry.JapaneseText: <Blue>闇の力<White>か…… <Yellow>聖者の力<White>と何か関係が ありそうだな。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems like there might be a connection between this <Blue>Power of Shade<White> and the <Yellow>Power of the Saints<White>.

Entry.JapaneseText: かたや聖なるもの、 かたや忌むべきもの。 どうなってんだろうな？
Entry.EnglishText: To some, divine; to others, an abomination. I wonder why that is?

Entry.JapaneseText: その辺り、族長から 聞くしかなさそうね。
Entry.EnglishText: It sounds like we should go ask the two Chiefs about it.

Entry.JapaneseText: 大丈夫？ 何があったの？
Entry.EnglishText: Are you okay? What happened here?

Entry.JapaneseText: わかんない……大人の人たちが 急にケンカを始めて……
Entry.EnglishText: I dunno! All the grown-ups started fighting all of a sudden...!

Entry.JapaneseText: このお花、もらってもいい？ もんで傷口に当ててあげれば お薬になるわ。
Entry.EnglishText: May I take this flower? If applied to a wound, it'll help it heal faster.

Entry.JapaneseText: この人たち、どこかで休ませて あげられないかしら。
Entry.EnglishText: Do you know of anywhere we can let these people rest?

Entry.JapaneseText: 宿屋だったら、いくつか ベッドもあるよ。
Entry.EnglishText: There are some beds at the inn.

Entry.JapaneseText: じゃあ、宿屋へ運びましょ。 手伝ってくれる？
Entry.EnglishText: Then let's carry them to the inn. Will you help me with that?

Entry.JapaneseText: うっ、ううっ……ああ…… あんたたちか……
しっかりしろ。 何があった!?
……親父たちが<Blue>闇の力<White>を 取りに行った事を知って、 フォグマが親父を殺そうと……
Entry.EnglishText: Fogma found out that my old man was trying to get the <Blue>Power of Shade<White>, so he tried to have him killed...

Entry.JapaneseText: それで……親父は街のヒューマを けしかけて、フォグマを…… 止めようとしたんだが…… このありさまだ……
Entry.EnglishText: Then... my old man ordered the Huma to... try and stop Fogma... but this is what happened...

Entry.JapaneseText: お願いだ…… このまま争いを続けたら…… この街は……頼む……
Entry.EnglishText: Please... The fighting can't go on... You need to save this town...
...Got it. Come on guys, let's go!

Entry.JapaneseText: どこだっていい。 親玉を捕まえてぶっ飛ばしてやる。 目が覚めるまでな。
Entry.EnglishText: Anywhere! I'm gonna beat some sense into both chiefs. They need to get a grip!

Entry.JapaneseText: 殴るのはともかく、 この状況を見過ごす事はできない。 俺たちで説得してみよう。
Entry.EnglishText: I don't think that would do much good, but I agree that we can't turn a blind eye to this. We have to persuade them to stop fighting.

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ。 その前にハックとイゴルを 宿屋へ連れて行こう。
Entry.EnglishText: Right. But before that, let's take Hack and Igor to the inn.

Entry.JapaneseText: 二人に付き添ってやってくれ。 外は危険だ。おまえのためにも そのほうがいい。
Entry.EnglishText: It'd be in your best interest to look after these two. It's too dangerous for you to be out here.

Entry.JapaneseText: 将軍、制圧は ほぼ完了しました！
Entry.EnglishText: General, the situation is almost under control.

Entry.JapaneseText: 逃亡した者たちの襲撃に備え、 各自警戒を怠らぬよう通達せよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Those who have escaped may retaliate. Inform all the men that they must remain vigilant.

Entry.JapaneseText: ミルハウスト…… これは一体、どういう事だ？
Entry.EnglishText: What is the meaning of this, Milhaust?

Entry.JapaneseText: ラジルダは以前から、 ガジュマとヒューマの関係が悪かった。 近頃、前にも増して空気が不穏だと聞き、 軍を率いて来れば、このありさまだ。
Entry.EnglishText: Relations between the two races have always been poor in Razilda. I led the army here after hearing that things had grown more dire, and I found it in this state.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……なぜ、サレやトーマが、 おまえと共に行動している？ ジルバの命令か？
Entry.EnglishText: ...What were Saleh and Tohma doing working alongside you? Were they with you on Zilva's orders?

Entry.JapaneseText: 力で民衆を抑えつけるような やり方で、問題が解決すると 思っているのか？
Entry.EnglishText: Do you really think that suppressing the common people with brute force is going to make these problems go away?

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマとヒューマの 共存社会を取り戻すためなら、 私はどんな手段も辞さない。
Entry.EnglishText: If it brings about the return of a society where Huma and Gajuma will coexist once more, then there is no method too extreme.

Entry.JapaneseText: それが、私の意思であり、 延いては王国の総意でもある。 ジルバ様も、そしてサレやトーマも それに従っているだけの事。
Entry.EnglishText: Not only is that my desire, it is also the collective desire of the Kingdom. Lady Zilva, and Saleh and Tohma as well, are simply complying with those wishes.

Entry.JapaneseText: ならば手を携えて、理想を 目指すのは道理ではないのか？
Entry.EnglishText: Is it not reasonable, then, for us to work together in the pursuit of that ideal?

Entry.JapaneseText: でなければ、私とて…… 陛下が生きていてくだされば…… ……おまえたちが陛下を…… 陛下のお命を……
Entry.EnglishText: Because if not, then even I... If only her Majesty was still with us... If only your actions had not resulted... in Her Majesty losing her life...

Entry.JapaneseText: カレギアは私が守る。 誰にも手出しはさせない。
Entry.EnglishText: I will protect Callegea. Not a single soul will stand in my way.

Entry.JapaneseText: ねえ、<Eugene>…… ボクたちはボクたちに できるコトをしようヨ、ね？
Entry.EnglishText: Hey, <Eugene>... Let's just do what we can for now, okay?

Entry.JapaneseText: そうだな……ハックに 話を聞きに行こう。
Entry.EnglishText: I agree. Let's go talk to Hack.

Entry.JapaneseText: やあ、キミたち…… 遅くなったけど、 あいさつに来たよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Why, if it isn't you guys. I'm a little late to the party, but I wanted to stop by and say hello.

Entry.JapaneseText: これまで僕は、ずっと<Yellow>ヒトの心<White>を バカにして生きてきた…… 軽く遊んでやればいいと思っていた。 でも、それは大きな間違いだった。
Entry.EnglishText: For most of my life, I had spent my every waking moment looking down on the <Yellow>hearts of man<White>. I thought of it as something you could treat as a mere plaything. However, I've now seen the error in my ways.

Entry.JapaneseText: キミたちとの戦いで、 僕は<Yellow>心<White>の大切さを学んだ。 <Yellow>心の力<White>ほど強くて、大きくて…… ……不愉快なものはないってね。
Entry.EnglishText: I came to learn just how important the heart really is when we fought each other. The <Yellow>power<White> it possesses is as strong as it is deep... Definitely not something one would call unpleasant.

Entry.JapaneseText: だから…… 本気で叩き潰す事にしたんだ。 キミたちの……<Yellow>ヒトの心<White>をね！
Entry.EnglishText: And that's why... I am going to crush them under my heel... Your <Yellow>Human hearts<White>, that is!

Entry.JapaneseText: 今日はあいさつに来ただけさ。 将軍閣下の目があるからね。 でも、覚えといたほうがいい。
Entry.EnglishText: I've only come by to say hello today. We are under the watchful eye of the General, after all. But I suggest that you remember this conversation.

Entry.JapaneseText: キミたちが泣いて謝っても、 僕は絶対にやめないよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Because I am never going to let up, no matter how much you weep or beg for mercy.

Entry.JapaneseText: だって、キミたちほどの 強い心を踏みにじるのって、 とても楽しそうじゃない？ フフフ……
Entry.EnglishText: After all, doesn't the idea of pulverizing hearts that are as strong as yours just sound exhilarating? Hehehe...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……オレたちはオレたちの やるべき事をやればいい……
Entry.EnglishText: ...We need to do what we've set out to do.

Entry.JapaneseText: キョグエンへ向かおう。
唯一の手がかりが 燃やされてたなんて……
Entry.EnglishText: So our only clue has been reduced to ashes...

Entry.JapaneseText: うむ……処分されたとはいえ、 まだどこかに残っているかもしれん。 探してみよう。
Entry.EnglishText: Hmm... She said that every flag had been burned, but it's possible that they might have missed one. Let's look around.

Entry.JapaneseText: 申し訳ありません。 馬車は運休となっております。
Entry.EnglishText: We're truly sorry, but Carriages are not available for use at the moment.

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>お金が足りないようですね。 馬車のご利用料金は <nmb:12C>ガルドになります。
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000000>You seem to be short of money. The fee for using the carriage is <nmb:12C> Gald.

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>馬車をご利用になりますか？ 料金は定額で<nmb:12C>ガルドになります。
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000000>Would you like to use a carriage? The fare is a flat rate of <nmb:12C> Gald.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140><font:80000002>馬車を利用しますか？ はい いいえ
<speed:0><scale:140><font:80000002>馬車で<unk18:48DC0428B8048880>に移動します。 料金<nmb:12C>ガルド はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140><font:80000000>To travel to <unk18:48DC0428B8048880>by Carriage, it'll be <nmb:12C> Gald. Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: また軍が動いたらしい。 今度はミナールだそうだな。
Entry.EnglishText: The military is once again on the move. The next place is Minal, it seems.

Entry.JapaneseText: 各地で、種族間の対立が 激化しているが、ここは その最も危険な地区だ。
Entry.EnglishText: In many places, the conflict between both races is intensifying, and this is the most dangerous area.

Entry.JapaneseText: 軍の目を盗んでは 暴力沙汰が起きている。 くれぐれも注意するように。
Entry.EnglishText: There have been violent incidents reported to the watchful eyes of the military. Please be careful out there.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Blue>王の盾<White>の四星様と共に 行動できるとは、光栄だ。
Entry.EnglishText: It is an honor to be able to work with the Four Stars of <Blue>The Royal Shield<White>

Entry.JapaneseText: 噂どおり、トーマ様は力強く サレ様はクールな方で いらっしゃる。
Entry.EnglishText: You know, they say that Tohma is the strong and tough one while Saleh is the cool and collected one.

Entry.JapaneseText: また軍が動いたらしい。 今度はミナールだそうだな。
Entry.EnglishText: The military is once again on the move. The next place is Minal, it seems.

Entry.JapaneseText: 各地で、種族間の対立が 激化しているが、ここは その最も危険な地区だ。
Entry.EnglishText: In many places, the conflict between both races is intensifying, and this is the most dangerous area.

Entry.JapaneseText: 軍の目を盗んでは 暴力沙汰が起きている。 くれぐれも注意するように。
Entry.EnglishText: There have been violent incidents reported to the watchful eyes of the military. Please be careful out there.

Entry.JapaneseText: 近頃、にわかに 各地で種族間の対立が 取りざたされるようになった。
Entry.EnglishText: Recently, there has been a lot of talk amongst the people about interracial conflicts in many places.

Entry.JapaneseText: 今こそ、我らカレギア軍の 働きどころだ。
Entry.EnglishText: Now is the time for us, the Callegean Army, to step in and do our work.

Entry.JapaneseText: こうして軍に管理されている 地域が徐々に増えているそうだ。
Entry.EnglishText: The number of areas watched over by the military because is gradually increasing because of what's happening.

Entry.JapaneseText: 今度は軍がミナール近辺に 向かったという話も聞いた。
Entry.EnglishText: I heard that Minal is the next destination that the army is headed towards.

Entry.JapaneseText: この街は、軍指定の 特別警戒区域だ。
Entry.EnglishText: This city is a now classified as a special military zone.

Entry.JapaneseText: 用がないのなら 直ちに立ち去るがいい。
Entry.EnglishText: If you have no business here, you must leave immediately.

Entry.JapaneseText: 街の外へ出るか、 屋内に入っているか、 どちらかにしろ。
Entry.EnglishText: Either exit the city or stay indoors.

Entry.JapaneseText: 不審な者は拘束しても よいと言われている。
Entry.EnglishText: We were ordered to detain any suspicious personnel.

Entry.JapaneseText: 各地で混乱が起こっていて、 ミルハウスト将軍も お忙しいようだ。
Entry.EnglishText: It's quite chaotic in many parts of this city, and General Milhaust seems to be so busy with it all.

Entry.JapaneseText: ここを離れられて、 ベルサス、そしてミナールと、 本当に大変な事だ……
Entry.EnglishText: It's really tough out here, there's also Belsas and Minal that're having some trouble as well...

Entry.JapaneseText: よからぬ噂が流れて、 街の対立がいっそう 激しくなっている。
Entry.EnglishText: Rumors are circulating, and the conflict in the city is becoming even more intense.

Entry.JapaneseText: この街は現在、 カレギア軍の管制下にある。
Entry.EnglishText: The city is now under the control of the Callegean military.

Entry.JapaneseText: 妙な動きをすれば、 将軍閣下の知り合いといえど、 容赦はせんぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: I'll let you know that if you try anything funny, even if you're acquainted with the General, I will not spare you.
A medicine to calm the mind? ... I haven't the faintest idea.

Entry.JapaneseText: そういう事はお年寄りの方が よく知ってるんじゃない？
Entry.EnglishText: I think the elderly know better about such things.

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマなんて…… 本当、ロクなもんじゃないわよ。
Entry.EnglishText: But if it's for a Gajuma... It's really not a good idea to be asking around for it.
Since the Queen of this country...

Entry.JapaneseText: クレア！ ひさしぶり!! 元気だった？
Entry.EnglishText: Claire! Long time, no see! How have you been?

Entry.JapaneseText: まさか友達の顔を忘れたって 言うんじゃないでしょうね？ 私と約束したじゃない。
Entry.EnglishText: You're not going to tell me you forgot your dear friend's face, are you? You promised!

Entry.JapaneseText: 冗談よ♪ お城で会ったきりだもん。 すぐには思い出せないよね。
Entry.EnglishText: Just kidding♪ We only had a brief encounter at the castle. It'd be hard to recall right away.

Entry.JapaneseText: お城といえば…… 女王様は何がしたかったのかな？
Entry.EnglishText: Speaking of the castle... What do you think the Queen wanted, anyway?

Entry.JapaneseText: まぁ、偉い人の考える事だから、 私たちにわかるはずもないわよね。
Entry.EnglishText: Well, we can't possibly see into the mind of a person of that stature, can we?

Entry.JapaneseText: これからも、ずっと友達で いてちょうだいね！
Entry.EnglishText: I hope you'll always be my friend!

Entry.JapaneseText: 今度は私がクレアのところに 遊びに行くわね♪
Entry.EnglishText: Next time, I'm going to go visit you, Claire...

Entry.JapaneseText: ラジルダの旗？ 前はあったけど、最近 見かけないわね……
Entry.EnglishText: The Razildan Flag? There used to be some but recently I don't see them anymore.

Entry.JapaneseText: 残念だけど、私も持ってないわ。 どんな模様だったかも、いざ 聞かれると……わからないわね。
Entry.EnglishText: Unfortunately, I don't have one either. I don't even know what kind of pattern it had on it. I really don't recall a thing.

Entry.JapaneseText: 花屋の子なら、いつもの おばあさんのところに 行ったんじゃないかな？
Entry.EnglishText: If you mean the flower girl, she probably went to her grandmother's place.

Entry.JapaneseText: 生まれ故郷だけど、 いいかげん、うんざりね……
Entry.EnglishText: I was born and raised here, and I'm sick of it...

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマと顔を合わせるのが 怖いくらいよ……
Entry.EnglishText: I'm afraid of coming in contact with the Gajuma...

Entry.JapaneseText: ハックさん……？ ガジュマが探してる人ね？
Entry.EnglishText: Hack...? That person the Gajuma are searching for, right?

Entry.JapaneseText: 残念だけど、私には 心当たりはないわね……
Entry.EnglishText: I'm sorry, but I don't know anything else about that...

Entry.JapaneseText: イゴルさんが街を良くしようと がんばってるんだけど……
Entry.EnglishText: Igor is doing his best to improve the city little by little...

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマとガジュマは互いに 協力すべきだって話になると いつも話し合いがダメになるの……
Entry.EnglishText: Whenever we talk about how Huma and Gajuma should cooperate with each other, the discussion always ends in disaster...

Entry.JapaneseText: もう…… ダメなのかしらね……
Entry.EnglishText: Not anymore though... I wonder if it's just a bad idea.

Entry.JapaneseText: クレア……この街は一体どうなって しまうのかしら……
Entry.EnglishText: Claire... What on earth is going to happen to this city...

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマとヒューマが 憎しみあっても、 何も生まれないのに……
Entry.EnglishText: If Gajuma and Huma continue to hate each other like this, nothing will come of it.

Entry.JapaneseText: もうこの街では昔みたいに 穏やかな生活をする事は できないのかな？
Entry.EnglishText: Will I ever be able to live a peaceful life in this city again like I used to?

Entry.JapaneseText: あきらめちゃだめ。 みんなが仲良くなれる方法が きっとあるはずだわ。
Entry.EnglishText: Don't give up. There must be a way for everyone to get along.

Entry.JapaneseText: そうね……あきらめたら、 そこで終わりだもんね。
Entry.EnglishText: That's right... If we give up, that's the end of the story, isn't it?

Entry.JapaneseText: またクレアに助けられちゃった。 私、自分に何ができるか 考えてみるわ。
Entry.EnglishText: Claire helped me out again. I'm going to see what I can do to help her.

Entry.JapaneseText: ここのところ、 ガジュマとヒューマの対立が ひどくなってるの。
Entry.EnglishText: The conflict between Gajuma and Huma has been getting worse lately.

Entry.JapaneseText: うちの村は前からだったけど…… なんか最近、特に……
Entry.EnglishText: I've been in this village for quite a while, but... It's something I've especially been thinking about, if only recently...

Entry.JapaneseText: この前、泉のところで 見たコトのないお花を 見つけたの。
Entry.EnglishText: The other day, I found a flower at the spring that I had never seen before.

Entry.JapaneseText: 図鑑にのってなかったら 大発見かも……
Entry.EnglishText: If it's not in your book, then it'd for sure be a great discovery...
Hey hey, can I borrow your picture book?♪

Entry.JapaneseText: ありがとう。 ちゃんと見るから、 チョット待っててね♪
Entry.EnglishText: Thank you. I need some time to look at it so wait!♪

Entry.JapaneseText: 図鑑があれば 調べられるんだけどなぁ。
Entry.EnglishText: If only I had a book with pictures, I could find it!

Entry.JapaneseText: ねぇねぇ、聞いて聞いてっ！ 私が見つけたお花、 図鑑に載ってなかったの！
Entry.EnglishText: Hey, listen! That flower I found, it's not in the book!

Entry.JapaneseText: これは大発見♪ どんな名前をつけようかなぁ。 ……あっ。コレ、ありがと。
Entry.EnglishText: This is a great Discovery!♪ I wonder what name I should give it. ...Oh right, here you go! And thanks!

Entry.JapaneseText: どんな名前がいいかなぁー。
Entry.EnglishText: I wonder what kind of name it should have...

Entry.JapaneseText: うーん。これじゃない。 これも似てるけど違う……
Entry.EnglishText: Hmm... Not this one. This one is similar but also different...

Entry.JapaneseText: あっ、ごめんね。 もうチョット貸しといて！
Entry.EnglishText: Oh, sorry. I need some more time!

Entry.JapaneseText: 泉のところで見つけたから イズミノハナ……うーん。 もっとカワイイのが良いな……
Entry.EnglishText: Because I found it at the Spring, I'll name it the Spring Flower... I'd prefer something cuter though...

Entry.JapaneseText: 薬？ 薬なら薬屋さんか お医者さんでしょ？
Entry.EnglishText: Medicine? If you want medicine, why don't you go to the pharmacy or a doctor?

Entry.JapaneseText: ゼレン湿原の南にある ツルベナ荒野では 花とか全然咲かないんだって。
Entry.EnglishText: In the Crvena Wasteland, south of Zelen Wetlands, there are no flowers at all.

Entry.JapaneseText: 花が咲かないところなんて、 ちょっと寂しいよね。
Entry.EnglishText: It's a little sad to see a place where flowers don't bloom.

Entry.JapaneseText: なんだか…… 最近、街の中が イヤな感じなの……
Entry.EnglishText: For some reason... I've been having a bad feeling about the city lately...

Entry.JapaneseText: お花をかざれば、 楽しくなるのになぁ。
Entry.EnglishText: It would make me so happy to plant some more flowers around this place.

Entry.JapaneseText: 花はみんなを 笑顔にするの。
だから、わたし、 ここで村のみんなに花を 売ってるのよ。
Entry.EnglishText: That's why I'm here, selling flowers to everyone in the village.

Entry.JapaneseText: おまえは収容所で会った……
Entry.EnglishText: You're one of the people we met back at the prison...

Entry.JapaneseText: おお、ガジュマの旦那！ 大変だったらしいが、 もう大丈夫なのか？
Entry.EnglishText: Hey, it's the Gajuma fella! It sounded like you were having a rough time. Are you feeling better now?

Entry.JapaneseText: 鎮魂錠のお陰で助かった。
Entry.EnglishText: Much better, thanks to the Requiem Pastille.

Entry.JapaneseText: 困った時はお互い様だ。 それで、今は何を？
Entry.EnglishText: We all need a helping hand at times. So, what brings you here?

Entry.JapaneseText: ハックというヒューマの男を 探している。
Entry.EnglishText: We're looking for a Huma by the name of Hack.

Entry.JapaneseText: ハック!? そいつならさっき、 うちの親父とどこかへ出かけたぜ。 そいつが何かしたのか？
Entry.EnglishText: Hack?! If that's who I think it is, he went off somewhere with my old man. What's going on with him?

Entry.JapaneseText: <Blue>闇の力<White>を調べたせいで、 フォグマに命を狙われている。
Entry.EnglishText: Chief Fogma wants to kill him because he's investigating the <Blue>Power of Shade<White>.

Entry.JapaneseText: なるほど、<Blue>闇の力<White>は 俺たちヒューマにとっちゃ 「聖なるもの」だが…… ガジュマにはタブーだからな。
Entry.EnglishText: I get it... The <Blue>Power of Shade<White> is some kind of "sacred thing" to us Huma, but the Gajuma here think it's taboo...

Entry.JapaneseText: しかし、<Blue>闇の力<White>なんて本当にあるのか？ 俺にはどうにも信じがたい話だが……
Entry.EnglishText: Does the <Blue>Power of Shade<White> even exist? It sounds a little too farfetched to me...

Entry.JapaneseText: あんたの親父さんが、ハックを 使ってそれを手に入れようとして、 色々とヤバイ事になってるのは 間違いないぜ。
Entry.EnglishText: Believe me, if your dad is using Hack in order to get the power, then things are about to get real ugly around here.

Entry.JapaneseText: あんたの親父さんの目的は 一体、何なんだ……？
Entry.EnglishText: What exactly would your father want to use it for?

Entry.JapaneseText: さあな……どうせ、 ガジュマを追い出すとか ろくでもない事だろうよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I don't know... My best guess is that he wants to use it to drive the Gajuma out of town.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……この街の人は、どうして こんなにお互いの事を憎み、 争ってばかりいるのですか？
Entry.EnglishText: ...Why is it that the citizens of this town seem to do nothing but hate and quarrel against one another?

Entry.JapaneseText: そいつは俺が聞きたいね。 あんたはどう思う？
Entry.EnglishText: I've been asking myself the same question. Why do you think that is?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……すまないが、俺は行くぜ。 人を待たせてるんでな。 もし、親父に会ったら、 バカな事はよせと伝えてくれ。
Entry.EnglishText: ...Sorry, but I have to go. There's someone waiting for me. If you see my old man, tell him not to do anything stupid.

Entry.JapaneseText: イーガとハックが <Blue>闇の力<White>を求めているなら、 行き先はひとつ……あの泉だ。
Entry.EnglishText: If Eaga and Hack are searching for the <Blue>Power of Shade<White>, then the spring is the only place they could have gone.

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ、見てくれ。 この店には<Cyan>紋章<White>に描かれた 四つの花が全部置いてあるだろ？
Entry.EnglishText: Yeah, take a look. They're selling all four of the flowers that were on the crests, aren't they?

Entry.JapaneseText: 今、思い出したんだが、 ここを通りかかった時、 何か違和感を感じたんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: And I just remembered that something about this place felt "off" when we passed by it earlier.

Entry.JapaneseText: 違和感？ 特に変わった 感じはしないが……
Entry.EnglishText: "Off?" I don't notice anything particularly strange about it...

Entry.JapaneseText: そうなんだよ。 そうなんだけど、何かが 不自然な気がしたんだ……
Entry.EnglishText: Yeah... To be honest, I can't really say what it is, but something about it seemed unnatural...
<Veigue>! What the heck are you saying!?
I have no idea what you're talking about.

Entry.JapaneseText: うーん…… それじゃあ困るんだよなぁ……
Entry.EnglishText: Hm... That's kinda sus if you ask me...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……今、何かヘンな事 言おうとしなかったか？
Entry.EnglishText: ...Hey. Were you going to say something weird just now?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……いや、それは 見たところ普通だな。
……いや、特に大きすぎるとか 小さすぎるって事はないな。
Entry.EnglishText: No way... Flowers of any type can be big or small.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……そりゃあ、そうだけどよ…… なあ、マジメに考えてるか？
Entry.EnglishText: That's not wrong but... Hey, are you even takin' this seriously?
Did you remember something about them?

Entry.JapaneseText: いや、生けられた花は どれも不自然だってコトさ。
Entry.EnglishText: No, it's just that all of those flowers looked kinda unnatural.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……いや、それは 見たところ普通だな。
……いや、違うな。 それじゃない……
Entry.EnglishText: Nah, that's wrong. It's gotta be something else.

Entry.JapaneseText: 「ヒマワリ、スイセン、スズラン、バラ」 この四つの花の違いだぜ？
Entry.EnglishText: "Sunflowers, daffodils, lilies, and roses." What are the differences between these four flowers?

Entry.JapaneseText: スズランって白くて 小さくってカワイイですよね。 子供の頃、春になると、 よく野原に摘みに行きました。
Entry.EnglishText: Lilies are white, small, and cute. When I was a child, I used to go to the field to pick them in spring.

Entry.JapaneseText: おれは真夏の太陽を 真っ直ぐに浴びるヒマワリが 一番好きだけどな。
Entry.EnglishText: I like sunflowers best when they're exposed to the piping hot summer sun.

Entry.JapaneseText: へえ、<Tytree>らしいね。 暑苦しい男って感じ？
Entry.EnglishText: Heh, that sounds like you, <Tytree>. Like your hot-headed personality, don'tcha think?

Entry.JapaneseText: スイセンは寒い時期に よく水辺に咲いているわ。 見たことあるでしょう？
Entry.EnglishText: Daffodils often bloom near water during the cold season. You've seen them before, right?

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒマワリ、バラ、スズラン、スイセン。 四季を彩るどれも美しい花だ。
Entry.EnglishText: Sunflowers, roses, lilies, and daffodils. They are all beautiful flowers that color the four seasons.

Entry.JapaneseText: オレにはよくわからないが…… ここにある花は、同じ季節に 咲いたりしないんじゃないのか？
Entry.EnglishText: I'm no expert, but... The flowers here aren't supposed to be in bloom within the same season, are they?

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒマワリ、スイセン、 スズラン……そして、バラ。
この四つは、 どれも違う季節に咲く花なんだ!! それなのに、この店には全部ある。
Entry.EnglishText: Those four flowers all bloom in different seasons! But they're all right here, in spite of that.

Entry.JapaneseText: これは…… 全部本物の花か？
Entry.EnglishText: Well... Are we sure they're all real flowers?

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ、間違いないぜ。 これは全部、摘んで間もない 天然モノだ！
Entry.EnglishText: Oh yeah, I'm positive. I don't even have to touch them to know that they're all the real deal!

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ、ラジルダの近くに この四つの花が同時に咲いてる 場所があるって事だ!!
Entry.EnglishText: Yep, there's gotta be a place near Razilda where you can find all four of these flowers in full bloom at once!

Entry.JapaneseText: そして、それがオレたちの 探している泉だ!!
Entry.EnglishText: And that's where we can find the spring we've been looking for!

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ、間違いないぜ!! 店の人は、どこに行っちまったんだ？ 探して話を聞こうぜ!!
Entry.EnglishText: No doubt about it! Where's the shopkeeper, anyway? We've gotta find her and ask about it!

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No
